title: Alexander Pushkin - Eugene Onegin & Other Works (7 books)
description:
ALEXANDER PUSHKIN (1799-1837) was a Russian poet, novelist and playwright of the Romantic era who is considered by many to be the founder of modern Russian literature.

This collections includes two translations of Pushkin's novel in verse, EUGENE ONEGIN (1825-1832), by Stanley Mitchell and Vladimir Nabokov (the latter edition appends two volumes of detailed commentary).  Several dramatic works are also included: his most famous historical play, BORIS GODUNOV (1831); the fragmentary SCENE FROM FAUST (1825); the four experimental LITTLE TRAGEDIES (1830), which confront greed, envy, lust, and blasphemy (in two translations); and RUSALKA, a lyric fairy-tale of despair and transformation.


The following books are in PDF format unless otherwise noted:

* BORIS GODUNOV & OTHER DRAMATIC WORKS (Oxford World's Classics, 2007).  Translated with Notes by James E. Falen.

* EUGENE ONEGIN: A Novel in Verse (Penguin Classics, 2008).  Translated with an Introduction and Notes by Stanley Mitchell. -- EPUB

* EUGENE ONEGIN: A Novel in Verse (Pantheon, 1964/1972).  4 volumes, Translation and Commentary by Vladimir Nabokov.
  - [Vol. 1: Introduction and Translation]
  - [Vol. 2: Commentary on Preliminaries & Chapters I-V]
  - [Vol. 3: Commentary on Chapters VI-VIII & Appendixes]
  - [Vol. 4: Index; Reproduction of the 1837 Edition]

* THE LITTLE TRAGEDIES (Yale University Press, 2000).  Translated with Critical Essays by Nancy K. Anderson.
